intro: Microjambosa besukiensis, commonly known as the Besuki microjambosa, is a rare tropical shrub native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
